Description: Rim and neck sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery krater; tall rim. White slip. Maeander band on top of rim, cable pattern on outside. At top of neck pendant lotus bud pattern. Reddish micaceous clay.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Clay analysis attributes the piece to Group A (Kalabaktepe, Miletus); see Schlotzhauer 2012.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 226, no. 129)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 117, pl. XXXVI, no. 330.2)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 147-8, NAU 115, pl. 25c-d)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.092)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5983 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
